Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells are studied under direct methane feeding with 10-70% CH(4).
Titulo: Oscillation of electrical current during direct methane oxidation over Ni-added LSCF-GDC anode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: When either La(0.58)Sr(0.4)Co(0.2)Fe(0.8)O(3-delta) (LSCF)-Ce(0.9)Gd(0.1)O(1.95) (GDC) or Ni-added LSCF-GDC composite is used as the anode, the oscillations of the electrical current and the formation rates of CO and CO(2) occur.
Titulo: Oscillation of electrical current during direct methane oxidation over Ni-added LSCF-GDC anode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The oscillation of the electrical current can be explained by a mechanism of periodic oxidation-reduction of the bulk lattice of the anode, with the determining factor being the build-up of the concentration of the oxygen vacancies to a certain extent.
Titulo: Oscillation of electrical current during direct methane oxidation over Ni-added LSCF-GDC anode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: As the methane concentration increases, the current density increases and becomes larger with Ni addition.
Titulo: Oscillation of electrical current during direct methane oxidation over Ni-added LSCF-GDC anode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Higher methane concentration leads to higher possibility to induce the oscillation, to start it earlier, and to result in a larger amplitude.
Titulo: Oscillation of electrical current during direct methane oxidation over Ni-added LSCF-GDC anode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Ni addition inhibites the occurrence of the oscillation of the electrical current but promotes that of the CO(2) formation rate.
Titulo: Oscillation of electrical current during direct methane oxidation over Ni-added LSCF-GDC anode of solid oxide fuel cells
